p:
Our results highlight the importance of developing a much deeper understanding of how fires evolved over the industrial period, especially since global fire models have mostly been evaluated against PD data
27 . The exponential increase in human population over the Industrial Era has restructured the fire landscape on all inhabited continents and created a permanent change in the energy balance of the atmosphere that has not been fully accounted for in climate models. Furthermore, it is highly likely that models participating in CMIP6 would simulate smaller anthropogenic aerosol radiative forcings over the industrial period if they used higher PI fire emissions.
